result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant's first appearance in Drug Treatment Court.  Court explains rules and outlines expectations of the defendant while in the program.  
Defendant is ordered to comply with the rules, expectations and instructions/orders or they will be subject to sanctions including placement on the weekly sanction list or immediate incarceration.
Waukesha County Drug Treatment Court Diversion Contract signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on 4/25/22

09:35 AM Defendant Lisa Marie Heider in court with attorney Pablo Galaviz.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case called for plea hearing.  Attorney Tempelis also appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Court conducts plea colloquy.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1. Court accepts plea as, knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily made. Court withholds entry of judgment as the defendant has been accepted into DTC. Court approves the Waukesha County DTC Diversion Contract.
Proposed Waukesha County Drug Treatment Court Diversion Contract, filed by Attorney Pablo Galaviz
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: 09:22 AM Defendant Lisa Marie Heider in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Court takes recess at 9:23 am so the defendant may fill out the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel.  Matter recalled at 9:32 am with the same appearances.  Defendant requests the court appoint counsel.  Court swears defendant.  Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $125.00 per month commencing March 1, 2022.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court sets matter for a status of counsel date.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Court will allow defendant to appear by zoom for the next date.  Hearing scheduled for February 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
